Description: Small part of a thin sandstone whetstone (?) with square cross-section, one flat end, the other broken ; a short illegible text (?), two or three signs only, is carved on two opposite sides. The lost part was probably long, with a tapering end (compare to EA 18542 and 18543) .
Curator's comments: "A large number of tapering square whetstones of sandstone have been found in the Camp; and on a piece of one were some Phoenician and Kypriote characters" (W.M.F. Petrie, Tanis ii, Nebesheh and Defenneh, p. 74 § 70, pl. xl, 1); see also London, BM, EA 18542 and 18543, Boston, MFA, RES.87.126 and Bolton, 1886.28.28.
Bibliographic references: Petrie 1888 / Tanis. Part II. Nebesheh (Am) and Defenneh (Tahpanhes) (p. 74 § 70, pl. xl, 1)
Leclère and Spencer 2014 / Tell Dafana Reconsidered: The Archaeology of an Egyptian Frontier Town (p.78, p.129, p.185, pl.27)
